ygData.subject: Re: New Char
ygData.msgSnippet: I don t think that is nessesary,  You still have more intellegence than a maxed out human wizard or a maxed out high elf wizard, and both of them are very
ygData.messageBody:
I don't think that is nessesary, You still have more intellegence than a maxed
out human wizard or a maxed out high elf wizard, and both of them are very
usable class/race combo's. I'd keep him, but if you do start a new character my
suggestion would be to make the intellegence divisable by 5. I saw the equation
for calculating mana on the message boards during beta, and although I can't
remember exactly what it was; I do rember that they divided your Int by 5 when
calculating it. Lastly I would put any extra skill points in either dexterity
or wisdom. Dexterity will keep you from getting interupted as often and wisdom
will provide you with some magic resistance.

> From: "Thomas Sommer" <sommer_thomas@...>
>
> Hi,
>
> maybe you can help me:
>
> I've created a darkelf wizard und spent 20 points to INT, 5 points to STR
> and 5 points to CHARISMA (stupid, I don't know why i did that). Do you
> think it's worth to recreate my character spending 25 points to INT and 5
> to AGILITY?
> Or do you think the stats are ok and I will have no major disadvantages in
> the future? By the way I'm lvl 8 now.
>
> These are my stats:
>
> STR 65 STA 75 AGI 90 DEX 75 WIS 83 INT 129 CHA 65
>
> Greetings
>
> Sinadin
>
> !
